                  :ARG0-of (d2 / demonstrate-01)
                  :quant (m / multiple :op1 1000))

      :ARG0 (p / person :wiki "David_Cameron"
            :name (n / name :op1 "David" :op2 "Cameron"))
      :ARG1 (c / country :wiki "United_Kingdom"
            :name (n2 / name :op1 "United" :op2 "Kingdom"))
      :ARG2 (m / minister
            :mod (p2 / prime)))

# ::id bolt-eng-DF-200-192446-3811676_0094.6 ::date 2015-09-19T12:50:37 ::annotator LDC-AMR-15 ::preferred
# ::snt He has every right, and indeed, it should be his job to defend and persuade the Scottish electorate and population that the United Kingdom should remain, that Scotland should vote no to any such referendum.

(a / and
      :op1 (h / have-03
            :ARG0 (h2 / he)
            :ARG1 (r / right-05
                  :mod (e / every)))
      :op2 (r2 / recommend-01
            :ARG1 (j / job
                  :poss h2
                  :domain (a2 / and
                        :op1 (d / defend-01
                              :ARG0 h2)
                        :op2 (p / persuade-01
                              :ARG0 h2
                              :ARG1 (a3 / and
                                    :op1 (p2 / person
                                          :ARG0-of (e2 / elect-01))
                                    :op2 (p3 / person
                                          :ARG2-of (p4 / populate-01))
                                    :mod c2)
                              :ARG2 (a4 / and
                                    :op1 (r3 / recommend-01
                                          :ARG1 (r5 / remain-01
                                                :ARG1 (c / country :wiki "United_Kingdom"
                                                      :name (n / name :op1 "United" :op2 "Kingdom"))))
                                    :op2 (r4 / recommend-01
                                          :ARG1 (v / vote-01
                                                :ARG0 (c2 / country :wiki "Scotland"

                                                :ARG1 (n3 / no
                                                      :topic (r6 / referendum
                                                            :mod (s / such
                                                                  :mod (a5 / any))))))))))
            :mod (i / indeed)))

                        :ARG0 p
                        :ARG1 i2))))

# ::id bolt-eng-DF-200-192446-3811676_0094.13 ::date 2015-09-19T13:50:12 ::annotator LDC-AMR-15 ::preferred
# ::snt You argue that David Cameron should not be able to 'poke his big nose in' to the idea of Scottish independence - yet, Scottish MPs are able to do just that when certain English affairs are debated in Westminster (something English MPs are not able to do with Scottish affairs).
# ::save-date Sun Nov 22, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-200-192446-3811676_0094_13.txt
(a / argue-01
      :ARG0 (y / you)
      :ARG1 (r / recommend-01
            :ARG1 (p / possible-01 :polarity -
                  :ARG1 (p2 / poke-01
                        :ARG0 (p3 / person :wiki "David_Cameron"
                              :name (n / name :op1 "David" :op2 "Cameron"))
                        :ARG1 (i / idea
                              :domain (d / depend-01 :polarity -
                                    :ARG0 c))
                        :ARG2 (n2 / nose
                              :part-of p3
                              :mod (b / big)))))
      :concession (p4 / possible-01
            :ARG1 (p8 / poke-01
                  :ARG0 (p5 / person
                        :ARG0-of (h / have-org-role-91
                              :ARG1 (p7 / parliament)
                              :ARG2 (m / member))
                        :mod (c / country :wiki "Scotland"
                              :name (n3 / name :op1 "Scotland")))
                  :mod (j / just)
                  :ARG1-of (p9 / possible-01 :polarity -
                        :ARG1-of (d3 / do-02
                              :ARG0 (p6 / person
                                    :ARG0-of (h2 / have-org-role-91
                                          :ARG1 (p10 / parliament)
                                          :ARG2 (m2 / member))
                                    :mod c2)
                              :ARG2 (a3 / affair
                                    :mod c
                                    :mod (c3 / certain))))
                  :time (d2 / debate-01
                        :ARG1 (a2 / affair
                              :mod (c2 / country :wiki "England"
                                    :name (n4 / name :op1 "England")))
                        :location (b2 / building :wiki "Parliament_of_the_United_Kingdom"
                              :name (n5 / name :op1 "Westminster"))))))

# ::id bolt-eng-DF-200-192446-3811676_0094.16 ::date 2015-09-19T15:37:13 ::annotator LDC-AMR-15 ::preferred

      :domain (i / it

                                    :name (n / name :op1 "England"))))
                  :mod (p / perhaps :mode interrogative)))
      :degree (m2 / more
            :degree (f2 / far))
      :mod (i2 / indeed))

# ::id bolt-eng-DF-200-192446-3811676_0094.19 ::date 2015-09-19T16:02:47 ::annotator LDC-AMR-15 ::preferred
# ::snt I'm sure there wouldn't be as much appetite for independence north of the border if the Scots felt that they weren't subordinate to a parliament situated hundreds of miles away that doesn't really represent them (Holyrood is overwhelmingly full of centre-left MSPs, yet we effectively have a centre right majority government in Westminster).

      :ARG0 (i / i)
      :ARG1 (a / appetite :polarity -
            :mod (m4 / much)
            :topic (i2 / independence
                  :location (r / relative-position
                        :op1 (b / border)
                        :direction (n / north)))
            :condition (f / feel-01
                  :ARG0 (p / person
                        :mod (c / country :wiki "Scotland"
                              :name (n2 / name :op1 "Scotland")))
                  :ARG1 (s2 / subordinate-01 :polarity -
                        :ARG1 p
                        :ARG2 (p2 / parliament
                              :ARG1-of (s3 / situate-01
                                    :ARG2 (a2 / away
                                          :quant (d2 / distance-quantity
                                                :quant (m5 / multiple :op1 100)
                                                :unit (m6 / mile))))
                              :ARG0-of (r2 / represent-01 :polarity -
                                    :ARG1 p
                                    :ARG1-of (r3 / real-04)
                                    :example (c2 / contrast-01
                                          :ARG1 (f2 / fill-01
                                                :ARG1 (l / location :wiki "Holyrood,_Edinburgh"
                                                      :name (n3 / name :op1 "Holyrood"))
                                                :ARG2 (p3 / person
                                                      :ARG0-of (h / have-org-role-91
                                                            :ARG1 (p4 / parliament
                                                                  :mod c)
                                                            :ARG2 (m / member))
                                                      :mod (c3 / center-left))
                                                :ARG0-of (o / overwhelm-01))
                                          :ARG2 (h2 / have-03
                                                :ARG0 (w / we)
                                                :ARG1 (g3 / government-organization
                                                      :ARG0-of (g4 / govern-01)
                                                      :location (b2 / building :wiki "Parliament_of_the_United_Kingdom"
                                                            :name (n4 / name :op1 "Westminster"))
                                                      :mod (m7 / majority
                                                            :ARG1-of (r4 / right-04
                                                                  :mod (c4 / center))))
                                                :ARG1-of (e / effective-04)))))))))

# ::id bolt-eng-DF-200-192446-3811676_0095.5 ::date 2015-09-20T12:38:03 ::annotator LDC-AMR-15 ::preferred
# ::snt The idea that Cameron's ancestry should entitle him to vote on matters concerning the Scottish parliament is as ludicrous as my ancestry entitling me to vote in the Polish Sejm.

      :domain (i / idea

                                    :name (n2 / name :op1 "Cameron")))

                                    :topic (p3 / parliament
                                          :mod (c / country :wiki "Scotland"
                                                :name (n3 / name :op1 "Scotland")))))
                        :ARG2 p2)))
      :compared-to (e2 / entitle-01
            :ARG0 (a2 / ancestry
                  :poss i)
            :ARG1 (v2 / vote-01
                  :ARG0 i
                  :medium (g / government-organization :wiki "Sejm"
                        :name (n4 / name :op1 "Sejm")
                        :mod (c2 / country :wiki "Poland"
                              :name (n5 / name :op1 "Poland"))))
            :ARG2 i))

# ::id bolt-eng-DF-200-192446-3811676_0095.9 ::date 2015-09-20T13:29:08 ::annotator LDC-AMR-15 ::preferred
# ::snt The argument that the whole of the UK should vote on Scotland's independence is like saying the whole of the EU should get to vote if the UK ever holds an in/out Eu membership referendum.
# ::save-date Wed Sep 23, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-200-192446-3811676_0095_9.txt
(r / resemble-01
      :ARG1 (a / argue-01
            :ARG1 (r2 / recommend-01
                  :ARG1 (v / vote-01
                        :ARG0 (c / country :wiki "United_Kingdom"
                              :name (n / name :op1 "UK")
                              :mod (w / whole))
                        :ARG1 (d / depend-01 :polarity -
                              :ARG0 (c2 / country :wiki "Scotland"
                                    :name (n2 / name :op1 "Scotland"))))))
      :ARG2 (s / say-01
            :ARG1 (r3 / recommend-01
                  :ARG1 (g / get-22
                        :ARG0 (o / organization :wiki "European_Union"
                              :name (n3 / name :op1 "EU"))
                        :ARG1 (v2 / vote-01
                              :ARG0 o
                              :condition (h / hold-04
                                    :ARG0 c
                                    :ARG1 (r4 / referendum
                                          :topic (h2 / have-org-role-91
                                                :ARG1 o
                                                :ARG2 (m / membership))
                                          :mod (i / in-out))
                                    :time (e / ever)))))))

# ::id bolt-eng-DF-200-192446-3811676_0095.16 ::date 2015-09-20T15:27:43 ::annotator LDC-AMR-15 ::preferred

                        :ARG1-of (p3 / possible-01))))
      :concession-of (a2 / and
            :op1 (i2 / industry :polarity -
                  :mod (h2 / heavy)
                  :ARG1-of (m4 / major-02))
            :op2 (p / population
                  :quant (o / over
                        :op1 (p2 / product-of :op1 "1/3" :op2 1000000)
                        :degree (l2 / little)))

                              :location (l3 / level
                                    :mod (u2 / university)
                                    :location (u3 / university
                                          :mod (s2 / state)))))
                  :degree (u / universal))))

                        :ARG1 (b / bailout))
                  :manner (a / active)
                  :compared-to (s2 / support-01
                        :ARG0 (c2 / country))))
      :op2 (c3 / connect-01 :polarity -
            :ARG1 o
            :compared-to c2
            :manner (s3 / social-03))
      :op3 (e4 / employ-01
            :ARG0 o
            :ARG1 (p / percentage
                  :ARG1-of (i / include-91
                        :ARG2 (p2 / person))
                  :mod (s4 / small
                        :degree (e5 / extreme))
                  :ARG1-of (c4 / connect-01
                        :manner (p3 / political))
                  :ARG0-of (h / have-03
                        :ARG1 (i2 / identity :polarity -
                              :mod (n2 / nation))))))

                              :destination (c / country :wiki "Israel" :name (n / name :op1 "Israel"))
                              :frequency (c2 / constant))
                        :quant (m / much)))))

# ::id bolt-eng-DF-200-192451-5796135_0085.19 ::date 2015-10-08T10:46:57 ::annotator LDC-AMR-15 ::preferred
# ::snt Why does the US and Israel having favoured factions justify Iran to do the same.
# ::save-date Sun Nov 22, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-200-192451-5796135_0085_19.txt
(j / justify-01
      :ARG0 (h / have-03
            :ARG0 (a / and
                  :op1 (c / country :wiki "United_States" :name (n / name :op1 "US"))
                  :op2 (c2 / country :wiki "Israel" :name (n2 / name :op1 "Israel")))
            :ARG1 (f / faction
                  :ARG1-of (f2 / favor-01
                        :ARG0 a)))
      :ARG1 (d / do-02

                                          :mod (f / foreign)

      :ARG1 (r / responsible-01
            :ARG0 p
            :ARG1 (a4 / attack-01
                  :ARG2 (b / bomb-01

                                                      :quant (a2 / at-least :op1 6)))))))
                  :mod (t2 / terrorist)
                  :mod (a5 / another)))

# ::save-date Mon Nov 16, 2015 ::file nyt_eng_20130703_0214_1.txt
(r / reverse-01
      :ARG0 (c2 / court
            :mod (c / country :wiki "Afghanistan" :name (n / name :op1 "Afghanistan")))
      :ARG1 (c3 / convict-01
            :ARG0 c2
            :ARG2 (t / torture-01
                  :ARG1 (w / woman
                        :mod (y / young)))))

# ::id nyt_eng_20130703_0214.2 ::date 2015-11-10T00:48:11 ::annotator SDL-AMR-20 ::preferred
# ::snt KABUL, Afghanistan - A court has reversed the convictions of three Afghans jailed for torturing a young relative who had refused to become a prostitute, alarming activists who had celebrated the guilty verdicts as a warning to all those who would seek to reverse the strides made by women here in the past 12 years.
# ::save-date Mon Nov 16, 2015 ::file nyt_eng_20130703_0214_2.txt
(r / reverse-01
      :ARG0 (c3 / court)
      :ARG1 (c4 / convict-01
            :ARG0 c3
            :ARG1 (p / person :quant 3
                  :mod c2
                  :ARG1-of (j / jail-01
                        :ARG3 (t2 / torture-01
                              :ARG0 p
                              :ARG1 (w / woman
                                    :mod (y2 / young)
                                    :ARG0-of (h / have-rel-role-91
                                          :ARG1 p
                                          :ARG2 (r4 / relative))
                                    :ARG0-of (r2 / refuse-01
                                          :ARG1 (b / become-01
                                                :ARG1 w
                                                :ARG2 (p3 / prostitute-01
                                                      :ARG1 w))))))))
      :ARG2 p
      :ARG0-of (a / alarm-01
            :ARG1 (a2 / activist
                  :ARG0-of (c5 / celebrate-01
                        :ARG1 (v / verdict
                              :mod (g / guilt))
                        :ARG2 (w2 / warn-01
                              :ARG0 v
                              :ARG2 (p4 / person
                                    :mod (t3 / that)
                                    :mod (a3 / all)
                                    :ARG0-of (s / seek-01
                                          :ARG1 (r3 / reverse-01
                                                :ARG0 p4
                                                :ARG1 (s2 / stride-01
                                                      :ARG0 (w3 / woman
                                                            :mod c)
                                                      :duration (b3 / before
                                                            :op1 (n4 / now)
                                                            :quant (t / temporal-quantity :quant 12
                                                                  :unit (y / year)))))))))))
      :location (c / city :wiki "Kabul" :name (n / name :op1 "Kabul")
            :location (c2 / country :wiki "Afghanistan" :name (n2 / name :op1 "Afghanistan"))))

# ::id nyt_eng_20130703_0214.3 ::date 2015-11-10T01:13:47 ::annotator SDL-AMR-20 ::preferred

                  :unit (d / dollar)))

            :ARG0 f
            :ARG1 w

                        :mod (j / just)))))

# ::id nyt_eng_20130709_0087.4 ::date 2015-11-11T07:58:15 ::annotator SDL-AMR-20 ::preferred
# ::snt The technology that allows the transplantation of critical organs also enables the far more common transplantation of tissue: bone can be used to repair fractures, veins for heart bypass surgery, and tendons and ligaments can restore mobility.

                              :time (d / date-entity :month 6))))))

# ::id web1-eng-DF-183-195685-4204154_0002.1 ::date 2015-09-11T16:26:39 ::annotator LDC-AMR-15 ::preferred

            :ARG1 (m2 / monetary-quantity

                        :ARG1 (t / transact-01))))

                  :degree (m / more))))
